name: My People
description: The breakout single for Sydney dance duo The Presets, 'My People' was one of the biggest hits of 2007 and propelled by the engaging music video.

key_work.title: My People – The Presets
key_work.brief_description: The breakout single for Sydney dance duo The Presets, ‘My People’ (2007) was one of the biggest hits of that year, propelled by the music video from director Kris Moyes’s use of sci-fi aesthetics in the clip.

constellations_primary.name: My People
constellations_primary.description: The breakout single for Sydney dance duo The Presets, 'My People' was one of the biggest hits of 2007 and propelled by the engaging music video.

start.title: Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?
start.creator_credit: Mike Nichols, Irene Sharaff, Ernest Lehman, Hal W. Polaire, T.J. Healy II, Chenault Productions, Warner Bros. Pictures, Richard Sylbert and Edward Albee
start.brief_description: A bitter, aging couple, with the help of alcohol, use a young couple to fuel anguish and emotional pain towards each other.

constellations_other.name: My People
constellations_other.description: The breakout single for Sydney dance duo The Presets, 'My People' was one of the biggest hits of 2007 and propelled by the engaging music video.

constellations_other.name: Breaking the Hays Code
constellations_other.description: The Motion Picture Production Code, known as the Hays Code, was a self imposed set of industry guidelines outlining what could and couldn't be shown in Hollywood films. Established in 1930 but not enforced till 1934, the code would eventually be replaced with the film rating system in 1968.

end.title: The Hours
end.creator_credit: Ian MacNeil, Mark Huffam, Robert Fox and Scott Rudin
end.brief_description: “The Hours” is the story of three women searching for more potent, meaningful lives. Each is alive at a different time and place, all are linked by their yearnings and their fears. Their stories intertwine, and finally come together in a surprising, transcendent moment of shared recognition.

constellations_other.name: My People
constellations_other.description: The breakout single for Sydney dance duo The Presets, 'My People' was one of the biggest hits of 2007 and propelled by the engaging music video.

constellations_other.name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

links.description: Who’s Afraid of Virginia Woolf? was an Academy Award-winning film based on the classic play of the same name. Nicole Kidman won an Oscar for her portrayal of Virginia Woolf in The Hours.

end.title: Boom Boom Pow -  The Black Eyed Peas (2009)
end.brief_description: Music video for The Black Eyed Peas hit song Boom Boom Pow.

constellations_other.name: My People
constellations_other.description: The breakout single for Sydney dance duo The Presets, 'My People' was one of the biggest hits of 2007 and propelled by the engaging music video.

links.description: The music video for ‘My People’ opens with The Presets on what appears to be the surface of the moon, before the duo become duplicated over and over. The aesthetic of the clip and their sound directly influenced The Black Eyed Peas hit ‘Boom Boom Pow’.

start.title: Boom Boom Pow -  The Black Eyed Peas (2009)
start.brief_description: Music video for The Black Eyed Peas hit song Boom Boom Pow.

end.title: X-Men Origins: Wolverine
end.creator_credit: Gavin Hood, Bryan Singer, Hugh Jackman, John Palermo, Lauren Shuler Donner, Ralph Winter, 20th Century Fox, Bad Hat Harry Productions, Big Screen Productions, Dune Entertainment, Marvel Entertainment, Seed Productions, The Donners' Company, Barry Robison, David Benioff and Skip Woods

video_links.name: X-Men Origins: Wolverine Trailer "Ooh! Shiny." | Trailer | 20th Century FOX
X-Men Orgins: Wolverine Trailer "Witness the Origin" | Trailer | 20th Century FOX

end.brief_description: After seeking to live a normal life, Logan sets out to avenge the death of his girlfriend by undergoing the mutant Weapon X program and becoming Wolverine.

constellations_other.description: The breakout single for Sydney dance duo The Presets, 'My People' was one of the biggest hits of 2007 and propelled by the engaging music video.

links.description: ‘Boom Boom Pow’ marked a huge shift for hip hop act The Black Eye Peas. The video clip, song and album The E.N.D saw them move into electronica, which front man will.i.am said was due to his exposure to The Presets while filming X-Men Origins: Wolverine in Australia.

end.title: Tsotsi
end.creator_credit: Gavin Hood, Nadia Kruger, Pierre Vienings, Peter Fudakowski, Industrial Development Corporation of South Africa, Movieworld Productions, National Film & Video Foundation of South Africa, UK Film & TV Production Company and Emilia Roux
end.brief_description: Tsotsi finds a baby in the back seat of a car that he has just stolen. He decides that it’s his responsibility to take care of the baby and in the process learns that maybe the gangster life isn’t the best way.

constellations_other.name: My People
constellations_other.description: The breakout single for Sydney dance duo The Presets, 'My People' was one of the biggest hits of 2007 and propelled by the engaging music video.

links.description: Several tracks off The Presets album Apocalypso hit big towards the end of 2007 and duration of 2008, which was when The Black Eyed Peas member will.i.am was filming a supporting role in X-Men Origins: Wolverine. It was directed by Tsotsi (2005) filmmaker Gavin Wood.

start.title: Tsotsi

end.title: The Constant Gardener
end.creator_credit: Fernando Meirelles, Odile Dicks-Mireaux, Henning Molfenter, Simon Channing Williams, Thierry Potok, Tracey Seaward, Blue Sky Films, Epsilon Motion Pictures, Focus Features, Potboiler Productions, Scion Films, Studio Babelsberg, UK Film Council, Mark Tildesley and Jeffrey Caine
end.headline_credit: China, Germany, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2005
end.brief_description: Justin Quayle is a low-level British diplomat who has always gone about his work very quietly, not causing any problems. But after his radical wife Tessa is killed he becomes determined to find out why, thrusting himself into the middle of a very dangerous conspiracy.

constellations_other.name: My People
constellations_other.description: The breakout single for Sydney dance duo The Presets, 'My People' was one of the biggest hits of 2007 and propelled by the engaging music video.

links.description: South African crime drama Tsotsi (2005) won the Oscar for Best Foreign Language Film at the 2006 Academy Awards, the same year another African-set crime drama won big: Rachel Weisz for best supporting actress in The Constant Gardener.

start.title: The Constant Gardener
start.creator_credit: Fernando Meirelles, Odile Dicks-Mireaux, Henning Molfenter, Simon Channing Williams, Thierry Potok, Tracey Seaward, Blue Sky Films, Epsilon Motion Pictures, Focus Features, Potboiler Productions, Scion Films, Studio Babelsberg, UK Film Council, Mark Tildesley and Jeffrey Caine
start.headline_credit: China, Germany, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2005
start.brief_description: Justin Quayle is a low-level British diplomat who has always gone about his work very quietly, not causing any problems. But after his radical wife Tessa is killed he becomes determined to find out why, thrusting himself into the middle of a very dangerous conspiracy.

end.title: The Spy Who Came in from the Cold
end.creator_credit: Martin Ritt, Paramount Pictures, Salem Films Limited, Hal Pereira, Tambi Larsen, Guy Trosper and Paul Dehn
end.brief_description: British agent Alec Leamas refuses to come in from the Cold War during the 1960s, choosing to face another mission, which may prove to be his final one.

constellations_other.name: My People
constellations_other.description: The breakout single for Sydney dance duo The Presets, 'My People' was one of the biggest hits of 2007 and propelled by the engaging music video.

links.description: Nominated for four Academy Awards, The Constant Gardener was adapted from the 2001 John le Carré novel of the same name. A former spy, several of his books have been made into award-winning films including The Spy Who Came In from the Cold .

start.title: The Spy Who Came in from the Cold

end.title: Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?
end.creator_credit: Mike Nichols, Irene Sharaff, Ernest Lehman, Hal W. Polaire, T.J. Healy II, Chenault Productions, Warner Bros. Pictures, Richard Sylbert and Edward Albee
end.brief_description: A bitter, aging couple, with the help of alcohol, use a young couple to fuel anguish and emotional pain towards each other.

constellations_other.description: The breakout single for Sydney dance duo The Presets, 'My People' was one of the biggest hits of 2007 and propelled by the engaging music video.

constellations_other.name: Breaking the Hays Code
constellations_other.description: The Motion Picture Production Code, known as the Hays Code, was a self imposed set of industry guidelines outlining what could and couldn't be shown in Hollywood films. Established in 1930 but not enforced till 1934, the code would eventually be replaced with the film rating system in 1968.

links.description: The first John le Carré adaptation for the big screen, The Spy Who Came In from the Cold starred Richard Burton in a role that continued a streak where he was nominated for an Academy Award three years in a row including for lead actor Who’s Afraid of Virginia Woolf? .
